items.message: River levels are forecast to rise at the Broadwey river level gauge as a result of the ground being saturated and reacting to heavy rainfall overnight. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wey, Preston Brook and River Jordan. Consequently flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 04:30 tomorrow morning (15/11/22). Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. The heavy rain is due from approximately 23:00 this evening (14/11/22) until 11:00 (15/11/22) followed by showers for the rest of the day, some heavy. We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday 15th November or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message: River levels are forecast to rise at the Charmouth river level gauge as a result of the ground being saturated and reacting to heavy rainfall overnight. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 3:00 tomorrow morning (15/11/22). Flooding is possible on the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. The heavy rain is due from approximately 23:00 this evening (14/11/22) until 11:00 (15/11/22) followed by showers for the rest of the day, some heavy. River levels can rise very quickly in response to rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday 15th November or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight and into Tuesday 15th November 2022.
Heavy rainfall is forecast in the East Devon area overnight from midnight through Tuesday morning.  This will cause water levels to rise in the River Axe area. 
The main areas of concern will be low lying land and roads close to the river. 
We expect the river to remain high throughout Tuesday and may issue Flood Warnings as necessary.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
We are constantly monitoring river levels and will have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Tuesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Donyatt river gauge due to expected overnight heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 04:30 tomorrow, 15/11/22.  Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Heavy rainfall is forecast overnight, with further showers expected over the next 48 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 12:00 on Tuesday, 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
